variable.name: F38VY
variable.comment: Visit year for which this form was collected.

variable.name: LIFEQUAL
variable.comment: Overall, how you would rate your quality of life? (Mark one oval in the box below.)

variable.name: SATLIFE
variable.description: How satisfied with quality of life
variable.comment: How satisfied are you with your current quality of life? (Mark one oval in the box below.)

variable.name: GENHEL
variable.comment: In general, would you say your health is (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: HLTHC1Y
variable.comment: Compared to one year ago, how would you rate your health in general now? (Mark one oval.)
variable.value: Much better now than 1 year ago
Somewhat better now than 1 year ago
Somewhat worse now than 1 year ago

variable.name: VIGACT
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activties. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, or strenuous sports

variable.name: MODACT
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activties. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Moderate activities, such as moving a table, vacuuming, bowling, or golfing

variable.name: LIFTGROC
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activties. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Lifting or carrying groceries

variable.name: STAIRS
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Climbing several flights of stairs

variable.name: STAIR
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Climbing one flight of stairs

variable.name: BENDING
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Bending, kneeling, stooping

variable.name: WALK1M
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Walking more than a mile

variable.name: WALKBLKS
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Walking several blocks

variable.name: WALK1BLK
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Walking one block

variable.name: BATHING
variable.comment: The following are questions about a typical (or usual) day's activities. Does your health now limit you in these activities and, if so, how much? (Mark one oval for each question.) Bathing or dressing yourself

variable.name: INTSOC
variable.description: Extent phys or emotional probs interfere
variable.comment: During the past four weeks, to what extent have your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your normal social activities with family, neighbors, friends, or groups? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: BODPAIN
variable.comment: During the past four weeks, how much bodily pain have you had? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: PAININT
variable.comment: During the past four weeks, how much did pain interfere with your normal work (both outside your home and at home)? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: LESSWRKP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You cut down on the amount of time you spent on work or other activities

variable.name: LESSACCP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You accomplished less than you would have liked

variable.name: LESSKNDP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You were limited in the kind of work or other activities you did

variable.name: WRKDIFFP
variable.comment: The next questions are about your regular daily activities like work, child care, or community activities. As a result of you physical health, have any of the following problems occurred during the past 4 weeks? You had difficulty performing work or other activities (it took extra effort)

variable.name: LESSWRKE
variable.comment: In the past four weeks, as a result of any emotional problem (feeling depressed or anxious), have any of the following occurred? You cut down on the amount of time spent on work or other activities

variable.name: LESSACCE
variable.comment: In the past four weeks, as a result of any emotional problem (feeling depressed or anxious), have any of the following occurred? You accomplished less than you would have liked

variable.name: LESSCARE
variable.comment: In the past four weeks, as a result of any emotional problem (feeling depressed or anxious), have any of the following occurred? You did work or other things less carefully than usual

variable.name: SICKEASY
variable.description: I get sick easier than others
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? I seem to get sick a little easier than other people.

variable.name: HLTHYANY
variable.description: I am as healthy as anybody
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? I am as healthy as anybody I know.

variable.name: HLTHWORS
variable.description: I expect my health to get worse
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? I expect my health to get worse.

variable.name: HLTHEXCL
variable.comment: Of these statements, how true or false is each for you? My health is excellent.

variable.name: INTSOC2
variable.comment: During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities (like visiting with friends and relatives)?
variable.value: A little bit of the time

variable.name: FULLPEP
variable.description: Did you feel full of pep
variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closet to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel full of pep?
variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.description: Have you been a very nervous person

variable.value: A good bit of the time
A little bit of the time

variable.comment: These questions are about how you feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks. Give the one answer that comes closet to the way you have been feeling. Did you feel worn out?

variable.name: HAPPY

variable.comment: Can you eat: Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.description: Can you dress and undress self

variable.value: With some help (help in/out, tub attach)

variable.name: SPOUSDIE
variable.description: Did your spouse or partner die
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did your spouse or partner die? Not collected on all versions of Form 38.
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.name: SPOUSILL
variable.description: Did your spouse have a serious illness
variable.comment: Below are some hard things that sometimes happen to people. Please try to think back over the past year to remember if any of these things happened. Mark the answer that seems best. Over the past year: Did your spouse or partner have a serious illness? Not collected on all versions of Form 38.
variable.value: Yes and upset me: Not too much
Yes and upset me: Very much

variable.name: FRIENDIE

variable.name: SAD2WK
variable.description: Felt sad for two weeks or more
variable.comment: In the past year, have you had two weeks or more during which you felt sad, blue, or depressed, or lost pleasure in things that you usually cared about or enjoyed? Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: SAD2YRS
variable.description: Felt sad for two or more years
variable.comment: Have you had two years or more in your life when you felt depressed or sad on most days, even if you felt okay sometimes? Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: SADMUCH
variable.description: Felt sad much of past year
variable.comment:
Have you felt depressed or sad much of the time in the past year? Sub-question of F38 V6 Q57 'Felt sad two or more years'.
Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: MEDSLEEP
variable.description: Did you take medication for sleep
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you take any kind of medication or alcohol at bedtime to help you sleep?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: FALLSLP
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you fall asleep during quiet activities like reading, watching TV, or riding in a car?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: NAP
variable.description: Did you nap during the day
variable.comment: These next questions are about your sleep habits. Please mark one of the answers for each of the following questions. Pick the answer that best describes how often you experienced the situation in the past 4 weeks. Did you nap during the day?
variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.value: Yes, less than once a week
Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: WAKENGHT

Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: UPEARLY

variable.value: Yes, less than once a week

Yes, 5 or more times a week

variable.name: SNORE

variable.name: QUALSLP
variable.comment: Overall, was your typical night's sleep during the past 4 weeks:

variable.name: HRSSLP
variable.comment: About how many hours of sleep did you get on a typical night during the past 4 weeks?

variable.name: INCONT
variable.comment: Have you ever leaked even a very small amount of urine involuntarily and you couldn't control it?

variable.name: FRQINCON
variable.comment: How often does this leaking urine occur? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
variable.value: One or more times a week

variable.name: NOINCON
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) No longer leak urine Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: CGHINCON
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) When I cough, laugh, sneeze, lift, stand up. Or exercise Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: TOINCON
variable.description: Leak urine when can't get to toilet
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) When I feel the need to urinate and can't get to a toilet fast enough Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: SLPINCON
variable.description: Leak urine when I am sleeping
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) When I sleep Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: OTHINCON
variable.comment:
When do you usually leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Other Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Not collected on all versions of Form 38.

variable.name: LEAKAMT
variable.description: How much urine do you lose
variable.comment:
How much urine do you usually lose when it leaks? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: NOPRTCT
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) None Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: MINIPAD
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Mini-pad, tissue or towel Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: MENSPAD
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Menstrual pad or shield Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: DIAPER
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Diaper, towel, Attends, Depends Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: OTHPRTCT
variable.comment:
What protection do you wear in case you leak urine? (Mark all that apply.) Other Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: INCONLMT
variable.description: How often does leakage limit activities
variable.comment:
How often does the leakage of urine limit your daily activities? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: INCONDIS
variable.comment:
How much does the leakage of urine bother or disturb you? (Mark one oval.) Sub-question of F38 V6 Q68 'Ever leaked urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).
Sub-question of F38 V6 Q70 'No longer leak urine' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: MARRIED
variable.comment: Are you currently married or in an intimate relationship with at least one person?

variable.name: SEXACTIV
variable.comment: Did you have any sexual activity with a partner in the last year?

variable.name: SATSEX
variable.comment: How satisfied are you with your current sexual activities, either with a partner or alone? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: SATFRQSX
variable.comment: Are you satisfied with the frequency of your sexual activity, or would you like to have sex more or less often? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: SEXWORRY
variable.description: Worried sex activity will affect healh
variable.comment: Are you worried that sexual activities will affect your health? (Mark one oval.)

variable.name: ACTDLY
variable.comment: Computed from Forms 36/38, questions 39-42. Source: WHI BAC. Four items describing basic activities (whether can eat, dress, get in and out of bed, and take a bath) each of which has three possible values (1=without help, 2=some help, 3=completely unable) are summed. A lower score indicates greater ability to cope with daily living activities. Missing if any of the four items are missing.

variable.name: EMOLIMIT
variable.description: Role limitation due to emotional problem
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 22, 23, and 24. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on role limitations due to emotional problems. EMOLIMIT ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: EMOWELL
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 31, 32, 33, 35, and 37. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on emotional well-being. EMOWELL ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: ENERFAT
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 30, 34, 36, and 38. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on energy/fatigue. ENERFAT ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: GENHLTH
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 3, 25, 26, 27, and 28. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on general health. GENHLTH ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: LFEVENT1
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 44.1, and 45-54. Source: WHI BAC; based on measures used in the Alameda County Study and BHAT. The eleven items are recoded, setting original responses from 1-3 equal to 1, and then summed. The construct has a range from 0 to 11 with a higher score indicating a greater number of life events. Missing if any of the eleven items are missing.

variable.name: LFEVENT2
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 44.1, and 45-54. Source: WHI BAC; based on measures used in the Alameda County Study and BHAT. This construct is a sum of the eleven items that are coded from 0-3 resulting in a range from 0 to 33 with a higher score indicating a greater number of life events. If any of the eleven items are missing, LFEVENT2 is set to missing.

variable.name: PAIN
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 16 and 17. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on pain. PAIN ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PHYLIMIT
variable.description: Role limitations due to physical health
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 18-21. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on role limitations due to physical health. PHYLIMIT ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PHYSFUN
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 5-14. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on physical functioning. PHYSFUN ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: PSHTDEP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 55.1-55.6, 56, 57, and 57.1. Source: Center for Epidemiological Studies; depression scale (CES-D, short form). PSHTDEP ranges from 0 to 1 with a higher score indicating a greater likelihood of depression. Cutoff values of .06 and .009 have been used to indicate depression.

variable.name: SLPDSTRB
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 61-64 and 66. Sum of five components. Questions 61-64 range from 1-5 and question 66 is recoded and reverse coded resulting in a range from 0-4 before summing. The summary score ranges from 0 to 20 where a higher score indicates greater sleep disturbance. Missing if any of the five components is missing.

variable.name: SOCFUNC
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 15 and 29. Source: Rand 36-Item Health Survey (SF-36). Quality of life subscale on social functioning. SOCFUNC ranges from 0 to 100 with a higher score indicating a more favorable health state.

variable.name: SYMPTOM
variable.comment: Computed from Form 36/38, questions 43.1-43.34. Source: PEPI, national and other surveys. Average of 34 items measuring occurrence and severity of symptoms. The summary score ranges from 0 to 3 where a higher score indicates more numerous and/or more severe symptoms. Missing if any of the 34 items is missing.
